Whenever I see policemen holding jotter and biro, mounting check points in every corner of Lagos I think Education for all by the year 2000 is about to be realised. Alas! those jotter contain the list of vehicle numbers - those who have given Egunje for the day and those who have not. Well it is Christmas period. Dele Taiwo, the funky juju crooner is back on the block after the series of travails be went through. First was the copyright problem with MCSN, then be dropped five erring band boys in a re-organisation. Now be is launching a N1.5 million musical instrument. The Waka. Queen, Alhaja Salawa Abeni, has said that her brand of fuji music, Waka, has come to stay and there is no changing it. The Waka. Queen, Alhaja Salawa Abeni, has said that her brand of fuji music, Waka, has come to stay and there is no changing it.

Speaking in an interview with PMSbow World, Salawa said that the criticism of the introduction of fuji music into waka is misplaced, adding that she has come to give. the men a good fight musically, so that they would know that women should not be relegated to the background. The waka queen fur- ther-said that she has modernised waka with modern musical instru- inents such as jazz, drums; piano, keyboard, etc.. Speaking in an interview with PMSbow World, Salawa said that the criticism of the introduction of fuji music into waka is misplaced, adding that she has come to give. the men a good fight musically, so that they would know that women should not be relegated to the background. The waka queen fur- ther-said that she has modernised waka with modern musical instru- inents such as jazz, drums; piano, keyboard, etc..

- "Don't you see the introduction of modern instruments into fuji, juju and other music," she asked. Saying waka will not be an excep- tion, Salawa said the slow tempo was changed to fast and danceable beats to satisfy the aspiration of her fans, both old and young. Charly Boy UnderPressure To Change Image Charly Boy UnderPressure To Change Image

The Gbagada bad boy, Charly Oputa a.k.a. Charly Boy appears to be under sc- vere pressure from kids to change his weird image. PMShow World source close to the Gbagada home of Charly Boy disclosed that though determined to keep all Nigerian kids, outofschool due to teachers' strike ac- tion, positively busy, Charly Boy is worried that his weird image-would affect the kids. The punk king is said to be toying with the ideaofchang- ing his weird look so as to have a positive impression on the kids. The Gbagada bad boy, Charly Oputa a.k.a.
